AxF Decoding SDK  1.5
Decoding AxF representations
AxF Decoding SDK

Table of Contents

  • Integrating the SDK
    • AxF Integration and Validation Package
  • Versioning and Changelog
  • Patents and Acknowledgements
  • Usage Conditions

The AxF Decoding SDK consists of the namespace axf::decoding, which offers functionality for reading and decoding material representations from an AxF file.

A representation in AxF terms is a specific digital encoding of the appearance of a material. Different representation types are analogous to different compression types for images like JPG or PNG which both represent digital images but use quite different techniques internally to encode these images (e.g. JPG is a lossy compression technique based on the DCT while PNG is lossless and uses entropy encoding); see also axf::decoding::axfGetNumberOfRepresentations().

Integrating the SDK

The current version of the AxF Decoding SDK is available as precompiled (dynamic) library for Windows (supporting all Visual C++ versions >= 2010), Mac OS X, and Linux-based operating systems. In order to avoid any possible issues with C++ runtime libraries and different compiler versions, the SDK has no C++ runtime dependencies in the header files.

General guidelines for integrating AxF into 3rd-party applications can be found in the Integration Guidelines and the Performance Guidelines.

AxF Integration and Validation Package

On request, X-Rite provides a preliminary set of simple reference scenes, materials and images to easily validate the correct implementation of the AxF SVBRDF and Carpaint representations. The package will be further developed based on user feedback.

Versioning and Changelog

Starting with version 1.1.2, the versioning of the SDK follows the AxF version, i.e. major and minor SDK version correspond to the highest supported AxF version. See VERSION.TXT for a detailed changelog.

Patents and Acknowledgements

For information on patents and third party libraries used by this SDK, see AxF-SDK-Acknowledgements.html.

Usage Conditions

Usage of the AxF Decoding SDK is free as long as the user has signed a ROYALTY FREE SDK LICENSE AGREEMENT that can be requested from X-Rite (see contact details below). Free use of the AxF Decoding SDK is covered by the royalty free license agreement for the AxF SDK since the AxF Decoding SDK is a component of the AxF SDK.
